entry.content:

Is it possible to edit script for story filters? It seems that the edit script button in only available for input controls in story page.

Thank you in advance. 

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: Moving Dimension Comment to the far right of my table widget
entry.content:
Hello,

I am creating a story in SAP Analytics Cloud to support monthly reporting using a table. I would like to use the Dimension Comment feature for this report. However, whenever I add the dimension comment column to the table, it appears at the start of the columns. I need it to display at the end of the table instead.

Is there a way to move the dimension comment column to the end of the table? Or any workaround to achieve this?

Thank you in advance for your help!

Any insights or tips would be appreciated! Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Is it possible to set input controls to refresh data only once after all selections are completed?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Every time I check or uncheck an item in input controls, the data in SAC story will refresh automatically. But I have a lot of widgets in the story, every refresh takes some time. So I am wondering whether it is possible to let the story just refresh once after I finished selecting all items in input controls.

Any tips or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thank you in advance.

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud to S4HANA Live Connection CDS view access
entry.content:
Hi,

Does an SAC to S/4HANA Live connection provide access to all CDS views in S/4HANA? We have S4HANA Tunnel Connection with SSO.

I understand that only consumption views are visible, but my question is more from a functional access perspective.

For example, we have below views in S4HANA system.

  • 2 views related to OTC,

  • 2 views related to RTR, and

  • 2 views related to STP

I only have access to OTC in S/4HANA:

Will I be able to see all six views in SAC, with no data access on the RTR and STP views?
Or will I only see the two views related to OTC?

Thanks in advance!

Best regards,
Parag

entry.title: Duplicate records for specific dates in SAP Analytics Cloud import model
entry.content:
Source Connection: SAP ERP

Recently, I noticed that for two specific days in November 2025, the values are exactly doubled. This issue occurs only for few dates, and all other dates are correct.

POV:

Import mode: Update

Data in the source SAP ERP is correct (no duplicates)

The job has been running fine before and after these dates

No changes were made to the model or job around that time

My questions:

How is it possible to get duplicates in Update mode?

What could be the reason for duplication only on specific days?

How can I fix this issue and prevent it in the future?

Any guidance would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in Advance!

entry.title: How to optimize stories in SAC mobile so that users do not see "reloaded due to memory constraint"?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I've designed a three page story in SAC. For each page I've limited the number of widgets and tried to follow best practices according to help portal (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/fbe339efda1241b5a3f46cf17f54cdff.html?q=optimize).

However, I still came across "reloaded due to memory constraint" on mobile apps and mobile web pages. The story can load, but when I swipe, sometimes it will reload. And every time I opens it on mobile, it takes like 30~60 seconds. (I found that for some mobile devices, the story loads faster, but for the other they load slower. But I cannot expect all users using the best mobile devices...)

The story works pretty well on computer, the loading could finish in about 10 seconds.

I'd like to ask: for the mobile version of the SAC story, if I don’t want to see the message "reloaded due to memory constraint", how should I control the number of widgets on the page or adjust other content? I’m not quite sure where the threshold lies.

Any tips or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thank you in advance.

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: Scoped Roles in SAC
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I have the following problem in SAC and would be happy if someone could provide a solution on how to deal with it or vote for the change in the Customer Influence Program. This would really help us in the project: 

Name: Scoped Roles in SAC

Request ID: 363937

Link: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/363937

 
Please describe your improvement request:

Scoped roles (like in the Datasphere) should also be introduced in SAC so that permissions can be controlled more precisely in SAC.

It may also make sense to use spaces such as those in Datasphere to implement the requirements. If necessary, the spaces in SAC and Datasphere could then be mapped.

 

What is the opportunity/problem the request will address?

In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), granting edit permissions for a folder effectively gives the user edit capabilities across the entire SAC environment. If that user also has access to multiple spaces in SAP Datasphere, they can view all data models because roles in SAC are assigned globally rather than at a granular level. This becomes particularly problematic when sensitive HR data exists in Datasphere, as such data should only appear in a shared story developed by the internal SAP department.

Example Scenario: A user in SAC should:

  • Have view-only permissions for the HR folder to view the Story
  • In another folder, “A,” be able to create their own stories using data from Datasphere Space A.

To access both spaces, the user needs a consume role in Datasphere for each space.
The problem: Once the user has edit rights in any folder, they can also view the HR data model because they have a edit permission from a different Folder, which should not be visible.

What is the expected benefit?

The added value is better control of permissions in the SAC and thus better self-service that can be offered.

 


Thank You and Regards 

Niels

entry.title: How to pass filters between different stories in SAC
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am currently building several SAC stories, which include an overview story (Story A) and multiple sub-stories (Story B, Story C, and Story D). All these stories share 5 identical filters.

In Story A, I have configured 5 input controls and use the NavigationUtils.openStory script to pass the selected filter values from Story A to Stories B, C, and D. Conversely, I have added hyperlinked buttons in Stories B, C, and D to allow users to jump back to Story A.

Here is the typical user workflow: First, users access Story A, set the required filter values, and then use NavigationUtils.openStory to navigate to the other sub-stories. This script works perfectly well—it automatically creates corresponding story filters in the target sub-stories and passes the selected filter values accurately.

However, a usability issue arises when users jump back to Story A via the hyperlinked buttons: the previously selected filter values in Story A are lost, and the story reverts to its default filter settings configured during the design phase.

I am wondering if there is a more optimized way to design these stories to enhance the overall user experience.

(If I use NavigationUtils.openStory to jump back to Story A, I think it will recreates story filters for Story A, and then I will lose the possibility to select from different filter values and that is not good.)

Any tips or insights would be appreciated! Thank you in advance!

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: IAS Login Name dependencies
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Quick question about the Login Name field in IAS:

Does it matter what I enter here? I often see an email address, but could I also use an employee ID or a short name?

Are there SAP applications or scenarios that require the "Login Name" to be a specific attribute (e.g. Email), or is the field completely flexible?

I want to avoid SSO issues with specific apps if the value is wrong. Does anyone have experience with dependencies for this field?

Many Thanks

Best Regards

entry.title: Slow frontends (HTML5)
entry.content:
Hi, everyone.

We have been using this SAP frontend paradigm for more than 10 years with the launch of Fiori. I used the tools, applications, watched presentations, lectures, videos. I read reviews, comments, but I never found anything that expresses the most striking feeling for me about this subject in all situations:
These frontends are so slow. As far as it compares to the previous generation of SAP and other current frontends we have come across.
It's very easy to give up or get lost doing something else while waiting for the page to respond.

Does anyone else have this feeling?

entry.title: Issue with Data Authorization in Public Dimension of SAP Analytics Cloud Model
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We have implemented a model in SAP Analytics Cloud which includes a public organizational dimension with a hierarchy composed of four levels: division, business unit, sub business unit, and cost center. A story is built on top of this model.

We have defined data authorizations on this hierarchy, intending to control access as follows:

1. Users can see all data
2. Users can see data for one or more specific divisions
3. Users can see data for one or more business units within specific divisions
4. Users can see data for one or more sub business units within specific business units
5. Users can see data for one or more cost centers within specific sub business units

However, we are encountering an issue where authorization filtering does not work correctly starting from the business unit level and below. For example, users assigned read permissions at the business unit level do not see any data in reports, even though data exists and users with broader permissions see the data as expected. This behavior also occurs for the more granular authorization scenarios (sub business unit and cost center levels).

Has anyone experienced similar issues, or is this a known limitation or configuration consideration in SAC related to hierarchical authorization on public dimensions? Any guidance or suggested troubleshooting actions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for any support or insights you can provide.
